hero_subtitle: A community that supports youth from diverse family backgrounds!
hero_body: The Youth Association YOUTH OF DIVERSE FAMILIES works with and for young people who come from various family structures – single-parent, one-parent, children without parents, guardianships, foster families, and all other forms. Our goal is clear: raising awareness about different types of families, psychosocial support, legal support, and creating a large community that always supports each other and where everyone cheers for one another – because family diversity is reality, and youth deserve support without stigma.
pillar_1_desc: We provide extensive information and publish brochures and research on family diversity, mental health, youth rights and much more.
pillar_2_desc: We organize workshops, trainings, and educational programs that empower young people and help them develop their potential.
pillar_3_desc: We build an active youth community that advocates for change, equality, and support for family diversity.
pay_semester_teaser: The “Pay a Semester” program is our innovative support model for youth from diverse families who are students. So far, we have supported 107 young people with partial or full tuition coverage.
opportunities_teaser: Want to be part of the change?
opportunities_options: Become a member, program participant, volunteer, or intern.
support_teaser: You can support us through donations, partnerships, or by sharing our work.
newsletter_desc: Subscribe to our newsletter and be the first to learn about new opportunities and events.
newsletter_copy_email: Or send an email to: ngo.ydf@gmail.com
about_desc: Learn about our organization, our mission, vision, and the team behind our work.
about_mission: We are a youth association that works with and for young people who come from various family structures. Our mission is to raise awareness about family diversity and provide support for youth.
about_vision: A society where every young person, regardless of family structure, has equal opportunities, support, and acceptance.
team_stanisa_role: Researcher for Social and Youth Policies
pay_page_desc: The “Pay a Semester” program is our innovative support model for youth from diverse families who are students.
pay_page_impact: So far, we have supported 107 young people with partial or full tuition coverage.
pay_page_donate_desc: You can donate through the eCrowd platform or directly to our bank account.
pay_page_bank_details: Komercijalna Banka: 300000005356764 (reference: “Donation for Pay a Semester”)
pay_page_apply_desc: If you are a student from a diverse family and need support, contact us.
pay_page_step_4: Tuition is paid directly to the university
opportunities_page_desc: Check out the open opportunities to get involved with our organization.
opportunities_open_calls_desc: We currently have no open calls. Follow us on social media for new opportunities.
opportunities_useful_links_desc: Links to useful resources for youth and organizations.
opportunities_docs_desc: Download our application forms and informational materials.
opportunities_open_1_desc: Apply for our summer volunteer program where you'll work on projects supporting youth from diverse families.
opportunities_open_2_desc: Intern with our communications and social media team. Duration: 3 months.
news_page_desc: Latest updates and information from our organization.
news_page_empty: There are currently no new posts. Follow us on social media for the latest information.
news_1_excerpt: Over 40 young people participated in our interactive mental health and well-being workshop. The workshop covered topics such as stress management, emotional intelligence, and building support networks.
news_2_title: New Cycle of Pay a Semester - Applications Open
news_2_excerpt: We are pleased to announce a new cycle of the Pay a Semester program. Students from diverse families can apply for support for the summer semester.
news_3_title: YDF at the Regional Youth Forum in Tirana
news_3_excerpt: Our team participated in the Regional Youth Forum in Tirana, where we shared our experiences and best practices in working with youth from diverse families.
news_4_title: Partnership with UNICEF for New Project
news_4_excerpt: We signed a memorandum of cooperation with UNICEF for a new project providing psychosocial support to youth from diverse families in rural areas.
events_page_desc: Overview of our upcoming and past events.
events_no_upcoming: There are currently no upcoming events.
events_1_desc: An interactive workshop on mental health and well-being of youth from diverse families. We'll discuss stress management strategies, building resilience, and creating support networks.
events_2_title: Forum: Rights of Youth from Diverse Families
events_2_desc: Online discussion on the rights and opportunities of young people from different family structures. Panelists from civil society organizations, legal experts, and young activists.
events_3_desc: A five-day summer school focused on leadership, activism, and youth participation. The program includes workshops, team-building activities, and networking.
events_past_1_desc: Public forum with participation of 80+ citizens and institutional representatives.
projects_page_coming_soon: Coming soon! We are working on our projects page.
projects_1_desc: An innovative support model for youth from diverse families who are students. We provide partial or full tuition coverage.
projects_2_title: Mental Health - You Are Not Alone
projects_2_desc: A series of workshops and psychosocial support for young people from various family structures. The program offers free counseling and group support.
projects_3_desc: A leadership development program for youth from diverse families. Includes trainings, mentorship, and practical fieldwork.
projects_4_desc: The first comprehensive research on family diversity in North Macedonia, focusing on the experiences of young people and their needs.
support_page_desc: Support youth from diverse families through donations, partnerships, or by sharing our work.
support_donate_desc: Every donation makes a difference. Your support helps young people reach their potential.
support_partner_desc: Interested in partnering? Contact us to discuss collaboration opportunities.
support_share_desc: Share our work on social media and help us expand our community.
contact_page_desc: Have a question or want to collaborate? Contact us!

accessibility_desc: We are committed to ensuring accessibility for all users of our website.
privacy_desc: Your privacy is important to us. This page explains how we handle your data.
